description: Alterations to external appearance of existing building, including formation of 15th floor and alterations to roof top plant and construction of ground floor front extension and 9 storey rear extension in conjunction with change of use of educational establishment to B1 office with A3 restaurant use on part of ground floor and provision of 31 space car park, including 5 disabled spaces, 28 staff and 22 visitor cycle parking spaces, landscaping, recycling store and associated uses. Construction of part 3 and 4 storey building at northern end of site containing 14 flats (12 x two bed and 2 x three bed) with 10 parking spaces, including 2 disabled spaces, communal amenity space and refuse storage (Renewal of unimplemented planning consent P/2007/0256)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority the development shall be completed only in the materials samples and details of which are approved within planning application reference P/2007/5461: and drawing numbers:  6050(-) 010 Rev C1South Elevation 6050(-) 011 Rev C1 East Elevation 6050(-) 012 Rev C1 North elevation 6050(-) 013 Rev C1 West Elevation  and samples:  1. White textured render 2. Timber for infill and feature cladding. 3. Windows on residential to be Dark grey 4. RAL POL12 polyestered powder coated  5. Welford Buff multi brickwork  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The glazing details shall unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority be completed in accordance with the samples and details as further to the approved within planning application reference P/2007/5773 and drawing numbers:  6050(-) 010 Rev C1South Elevation 6050(-) 011 Rev C1 East Elevation 6050(-) 012 Rev C1 North elevation 6050(-) 013 Rev C1 West Elevation  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance to maintain the integrity and appearance of the building in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The hard and soft landscaping works shall be completed in accordance with the details approved within planning application reference P/2007/5462: and detailed on documents  WT1276- R02-Commercial Landscape Maintenance Plan dated 25th October 2007  WT1276-R01-Residential Landscape Maintenance Plan dated 22nd October 2007  The hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development  'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The landscaping shall be completed in accordance with the maintenance schedule approved within planning application reference P/2007/5462: and detailed on documents  WT1276- R02-Commercial Landscape Maintenance Plan dated 25th October 2007  WT1276-R01-Residential Landscape Maintenance Plan dated 22nd October 2007  The landscaping shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The following works only may be undertaken in relation to trees on site akin to the neighbouring pavements in accordance with details as approved (TPO can be lopped further to the schedule approved) within planning application reference P/2007/5900: as detailed  T1 Common Lime front area fronting Uxbridge Road crown lift to 2.5m from ground level. T2 Sweet Chestnut Front area closest to the building frontage. Removal of lowest limbs closest to the building to effect a crown lift building side only. T3 Common Lime. Front area closest to building adjacent to T2. Remove and replace with Cercis siliquastrum 20-25cm Girth tree. T4 Sweet Chestnut (small tree) front area remove. This tree is not covered by TPO and therefore does not require consent from LPA however for completeness it has been detailed in the application and response. T5  White beam Front area fronting Uxbridge Road crown lift to 2.5m from ground level.  The works to trees shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Works to Trees shall be completed prior to the commencement of the development and retained until it is completed, in accordance with the details approved within planning application reference P/2007/5892: and the following approved documents  WT1276L06 in part superseded WT1276-L09F WT1276SK27 Report on Trial pit Excavation to assess root presence (Trees 10 and 11) Addendum Arboricultural Method Statement for works in proximity to tree No. 2 (Sweet Chestnut)  Arboricultural Method Statement for works with the potential to Damage Trees.  The works to trees must be carried out in accordance with these approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.  Reason: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The works within the crown spread or the vicinity of trees shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved within planning application reference P/2007/5803: and the approved documents   Arboricultural Method Statement for works with the potential to damage trees  The works to trees must be carried out in accordance with these approved details unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.  Reason: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The boundary treatment shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved within planning application reference P/2008/2975: and drawing numbers  WT1276-D04 Rev C   WT1276-LO7 Rev B WT1276-LO9 Rev E 6050 (27) 04 6050(27) 110 6050 (27) 01 Rev A WT1276-L12 Rev B  WT1276-D10  And Photographs x 2 of Anticiea railings coloured dark grey,  The boundary treatment shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the units and permanently retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 and the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting those Orders with or without modification, the restaurant use on part of the ground floor of the development shall be used as an A3 restaurant only, as defined in the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, and for no other purpose, including retail and associated uses.  Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, to protect the vitality and viability of the Ealing shopping centre and the amenity of the surrounding area in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.2 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 18 'Places for Eating, Drinking and Entertainment'. | The restaurant use hereby permitted shall not operate outside the hours of 0700 -2300hrs Monday to Saturday, and 0900 - 2230 hrs on Sundays and Bank or Public Holidays.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 18 'Places for Eating, Drinking and Entertainment'. | The refuse and recycling collection arrangements shall be provided as approved within planning application reference P/2008/1518: and the approved document:  Refuse Strategy dated 19th December 2007.  The approved arrangement shall be prior to the occupation of the units. The approved arrangements shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Refuse and recycling collection shall not take place between the hours of 2200 and 0730 on any day.    Reason: To ensure suitable loading, unloading and refuse collection arrangements are provided within the site in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and the visual amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | The external lighting shall be completed in accordance with the details as approved within planning application reference P/2008/3785: and the approved document:  Lighting Specification Interior and Exterior by Lighting Design International (Document 4933-SO1 rev 01dated 30/06/08)   and e-mail from John Dyke Senior Designer Lighting Design International dated 10th November 2008.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to first use of the buildings and be maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the area, in accordance with policy 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The cycle parking shown on the approved plans (PL) 002 and (PL) 003, shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking spaces and associated access areas shown on the approved plan (PL) 002 Rev B shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The car parking spaces for the approved offices and restaurant use shall be completed in accordance with the details as approved within planning application reference P/2007/5460: and drawing no.: 6050 (..)00.  The car parking spaces shall be marked out and implemented prior to first occupation of any of the offices or restaurant and shall thereafter be retained unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies 4.3, 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Prior to the occupation of the office accommodation hereby permitted, a Green Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, that promotes sustainable travel for staff and visitors.  The Travel Plan, as submitted, shall include:  (1) Targets for sustainable travel arrangements (2) Effective measures for the ongoing monitoring of the Travel Plan that complies with the TRAVL monitoring methodology (3) A commitment to delivering the Travel Plan objectives (4) Effective mechanisms to achieve the objectives of the Travel Plan  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved Travel Plan.  Reason: In the interest of sustainable transport, in accordance with policies 9.1, 9.7 and 9.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 'Green Travel Plans'. | Details of measures for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) of the offices and residential units from external noise, vibration and odour, including aircraft noise and internal separation between the ground floor refuse storage area and the residential units, shall be carried out only in accordance with the details as approved under application P/2008/1303 and the approved documents:  External Building Fabric Report 2358/R/EBF dated 2nd November 2007.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: To protect the amenities of office workers and the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development shall be constructed in accordance with the details approved under reference P/2007/5027 and the approved document: Excel calculations sheet to accord with requirements to mask  the (rating) noise (level) emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997. The level shall remain lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason.  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the information indicated on the submitted plans, fitting out of the restaurant shall not take place until full details of the installation and operation of the best practicable odour abatement equipment and the height of the exhaust stack for the restaurant unit, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the restaurant and permanently retained.  Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 18 'Places for Eating, Drinking and Entertainment'. | Notwithstanding the submitted Energy Statement, an Energy Strategy demonstrating that the scheme reduces carbon dioxide emissions for the buildings by the minimum requirements of the building regulations, plus the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations by at least 20%. In demonstrating compliance with the overall CO2 reduction requirements, the applicant should adhere to the principles of the Mayor's Energy Hierarchy.   Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with policies 2.9 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 4A.1, 4A.3, 4A.4 and 4A.7 of the London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations since 2004) 2008. | Details of crime prevention and security measures for the buildings, car parking areas, cycle parking areas (including access controls to the car park and entrance doors), hard and soft landscaped areas and bin storage areas, shall be carried out in accordance with the details as approved on application P/2008/1060 and approved documents:  Secured by Design Compliance Statement and SPG 8 Safer Ealing (erratum at para 8.1 regarding planting).  prior to commencement of development. The details shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: 'Safer Ealing'. | Unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning authority the development shall be carried out in accordance with the details as approved on application  P/2007/5026 and approved documents:  Air Quality Assessment submitted by Jacobs dated November 2007.  to protect the future occupants from adverse air pollutants, and any remedial measures shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units, and permanently retained.  Reason: To prevent the pollution of the local environment and in the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 2.6 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality'. | Prior to the commencement of any development, details of a site construction method statement/ management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  o	on-site construction worker parking o	anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site o	delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) o	dust suppression measures o	wheel washing provisions o	site security o	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles     will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. o	details as to the location(s) for the storage of building materials and construction debris o	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 4.4, 4.5, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Servicing for the restaurant unit and offices shall only take place between the hours of 7.00am and 7.00pm Mondays to Saturdays and not at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.  Reason: In the interests of amenities of the occupiers of the residential properties at this and neighbouring sites in accordance with policies 4.11 and 7.2 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The access from Uxbridge Road shall only be used for service vehicles and not be obstructed or used for any other purpose in accordance with details as approved in application P/2007/5807 and documents:  3 x A4 sheets showing details of telescopic security bollards ref TPS 700  shall be implemented to control service vehicle access, (before commencement of the development) and these measures carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the office accommodation.  Reason: To ensure adequate rear servicing for the offices and restaurant is provided and retained in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on the neighbouring highway in accordance with policies 7.2 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place in any phase of development until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of Archaeological work for that phase, in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the archaeological remains on the site in accordance with policy 4.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall accord with details as approved under application P/2008/1158 and approved documents:   7071 (PL)012 Rev A, 7071 (PL)013 Rev A and SPG Access Compliance Statement  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and the approved remedial works shall be implemented before building works commence.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development  'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, full details, including samples, of the colour, layout and nature of the glazing to be utilised within the residential building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced and this development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
